headline: Alain Delon's youngest son sues siblings to have actor's will annulled
description: The renowned French actor's youngest son, Alain-Fabien, is seeking to annul a second will, armed with previously unpublished medical documents that allegedly prove Alain Delon's lack of mental capacity at the time of signing it.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Beijing on Tuesday, on the eve of a major military parade, for what was at least his 45th meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping since both leaders have held power. Their close ties reflect the alliance Russia and China have forged against the West.

headline: The discreet rise of facial recognition around the world
description: Driven by artificial intelligence and backed by some political leaders as well as private companies, this highly sensitive technology is becoming commonplace in many countries and is making inroads across Europe.

headline: Block Everything is 'a movement structured almost exclusively around radical left sympathizers'
description: Bristielle conducted a study in the online groups of the Block Everything movement on September 10. He found that only 27% of respondents claimed to have been part of the Yellow Vest movement in 2019, he explained in an interview with Le Monde.
